name: John Crisanto
tagline: UCI-Extension, Java II - Bug Tracker System Project
body:
### Project Overview
In our Java II course, we were instructed to design and build a web application that serves to track application defects.  The idea is that our system will be used to track defects against existing applications.  It is a simple system used by staff to track bug ticket requests from submission to closure.  

### Application Basic Features
* The system allows the user to view all open tickets for all existing applications registered within the system database.
* The system gives the user the ability to filter which application they want to view existing tickets for.
* The system allows the user to view the details of an open ticket. 
* The system allows for the submission of a new ticket.
* The system is configured to notify the assignee of the ticket through email upon updating or creating a ticket.
* The application utilizes a relational database as a mean for data storage, which allows information to persist between user sessions.

### Structure

The following folder structure can be implemented under your web-server:
* classes: .class files compiled from .java files
* jsp: the .jsp files are placed here
* ROOT: the .html and .css files go here
* WEB-INF: web.xml needs to be placed here
* images: place .jpg files here

### Authors and Contributors
First, I would like to thank my instructor, Kesha Smith (@ProfessorKesha) for giving us an opportunity to work on a great project such as this one.  I would also like to thank my group members Felipe Oliveira De Souza (@felipeJava1), Lawrence Van Sant (@LarryVS), and Samuel Ratemo (@sratemo)for all their efforts when we put this project together.

### Contact
John Crisanto(@JohnCrisanto) and my email is jcrisanto87@gmail.com.

### Download Link
Please visit and download the application source code from the "src" directory at the following link:
[Java II, Team C - Bug Tracker System](https://github.com/JohnCrisanto/JohnCrisanto.github.io)
